meanings.definition: Admit (someone) formally to a position or organization.
meanings.sent1: The principal inducts new students into the school during the assembly.
meanings.sent2: The president inducts the new members into the club every year.
meanings.sent3: The magician inducts the audience into his mysterious world of illusions.
meanings.sent4: The key inducts the mechanism into motion, unlocking the door to endless possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The conductor inducts the orchestra with a grand gesture, signaling the start of the performance.

meanings.definition: Introduce (someone) to a new activity or skill.
meanings.sent1: The coach inducts the young players into the team with a warm welcome.
meanings.sent2: The teacher inducts the students into the art of painting with basic techniques.
meanings.sent3: The chef inducts the apprentice into the world of culinary delights.
meanings.sent4: The mentor inducts the protege into the secrets of success, like a guiding light.
meanings.sent5: The guide inducts the tourists into the beauty of nature, showing them hidden gems along the trail.

meanings.definition: Bring about or initiate (an action or event).
meanings.sent1: The loud noise inducts a sense of panic among the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The inspiring speech inducts a wave of motivation in the listeners.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected twist in the plot inducts a round of applause from the audience.
meanings.sent4: The first raindrop inducts a dance of joy in the parched land.
meanings.sent5: The sunrise inducts a new day, painting the sky with hues of hope and promise.
